turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: Epileptic attacks are murder on your system. Rattle your internal organs like a paint mixer.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: My heart weeps.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Is it the truth?

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: There's that word again.  As I told you, I wasn't in the room when everyone started shooting.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Why did you tell us he shot everybody, Levi? You put him in for three murders, the man saved your life --

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: So I should stay silent about his misdeeds? The guns went off, I ran in, Childs shot me, Pike and Mueller were dead, and Dunbar was running out the door with the smoking gun --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Dunbar was running out the door? Ohhhhhh... See that's where I was confused, because I thought you said Nunez was running out the door.

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: No. I said Dunbar.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Huh. You know, I really thought you said Nunez. I thought you said "Dunbar was gone," My fault, I gotta check the tape on that.  Oh, yeah we taped the last interview. This one too. Cause it'd be a real break for us to catch you in a lie.

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: I believe your next line is "What are you trying to hide?"

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: Sorry to disappoint. I'm on painkillers for the injury -- they cloud the mind. You're right, it was Nunez. Any more questions?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Dunbar will testify that you were.

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: Then we'll leave it up to the courts -- His word against mine. What does his father do again? Steelworker?  Doesn't matter, I'm sure justice will be served. In any case, my father will definitely want to talk to you about all these questions, these accusations on his son. He's quite protective.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Something funny, Levi?

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: I was just thinking of what's going to happen to your careers when my father gets through with you.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Jail if he's lucky, the gas chamber if he's not --

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: I didn't do anything --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: Because of what I saw.  Who really killed West.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: Because I was standing next to him.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Or you, Levi? When is it finally going to come out that you were the one who killed him?

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: I didn't --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: But you can't prove it! You can't prove anything until we find the bodies!

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: You lied to us, Levi, you're going to the gas chamber unless you tell us where to find them!

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: I don't know --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Where are they!

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: Maybe --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: MAYBE WHAT --

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: Maybe he...

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: How are you?

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: Been better.  I read about what's been happening with you... I should have called --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: What kind of trouble are you in?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: That bad?

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: Would I have called you if it wasn't? If there was any other way --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Tell me what I can do.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: This is Warrant Officer Julia Osborne, the closest thing we have to an in- house investigator.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: And here you are going out of house. How's that make you feel, Jules?

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: The official term for it is "Clusterfuck". By the time Beth hit us, I'd canceled all off base exercises save one -- a six man cadet team and their Drill out in the bush. We're missing three and the Sergeant. The cadets are in their eighth week of the cycle, nobody here knows much about them, up to and including their names. But the Sergeant...

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: It's not West, is it? Tell me it's not West.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: A few years ago, the Army picked our good buddy as their go to non-com to trot out to the press to talk about the kinder, gentler military. He even did the standard video greeting played to all incoming Basic cadets across the country.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Well, he's a good soldier.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: The exercise was one of his Section Eight "private sessions". Left around 2100 yesterday and were scheduled for pick up at 0630 this morning.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: And the problem is you only got three.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: No, the problem is one's dead, one's got a bullet in his arm, and one won't talk. The one who won't talk was trading live fire with the dead one as we reached the pick-up.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: I'm assuming that's what made him the dead one?

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: Cadet Roberto R. Nunez. Killed right in front of me.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Which gives us about five hours. Why'd you call me?

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: The guy in interrogation said he'd only talk to a cop.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: And I'm the closest thing to it, right?

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: Tom, bottom line: I let those kids go out there. If JAG shows up and I don't have any answers for them, my career is finished --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: I'm not gonna let that happen.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: He's not done by a longshot, I can get more out of him --

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: He can wait. Kendall's out of surgery.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Pike killed West, Dunbar killed Mueller, Childs, and Nunez.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: Who killed Pike?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Someone must have got a shot off. He wasn't exactly a moving target.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: We've already been over the terrain twice. Nothing.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: There was a hurricane, Bill, the wind probably moved it.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: Habeas Corpus -- you have to have a body to have a crime.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Okay, then let's widen the search to include the endzone in Giants Stadium and the trunk of my car --

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: Without the body we have no physical proof. We need a confession.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: From Dunbar? I hate to break this to you, but I don't think he's gonna be all that psyched to put himself in for the death penalty.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: Nevertheless --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Nevertheless what'? Kendall will testify and that'll be enough.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: Not for me.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: You mean not enough to save you.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: JAG gets here in three hours. Try for the confession.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: Tom, where are you going --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Home, I'm done.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: What about the confession?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: You want a confession? Why don't you confess, Bill: people are dead and you don't give a shit about it! Only reason you called me is to protect your fucking job, you know this is your fault --

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: What the hell are you talking about --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: I'm talking about West! We had him, Bill, we were there. You're the fucking Base Commander, you knew what he did to Cadets and you let him go on the way he always he has --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: What I said before --

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: Was dead right. You think Dunbar's on the level?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: Does Osborne agree?

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: It's over. Time of death was 4:42. JAG's been notified and I called the Senator myself. My report will reflect that his medical condition made this unavoidable... you two had no culpability in the matter.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: That's horseshit and you know it.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: Maybe. But it's my fault and I'll carry it.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: You think you could explain all this to me?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: I wouldn't know where to start.  I guess it was about one man framing another. He thought if the other guy got blamed, people would over look his own wrong doings.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: They're taking your command, aren't they?

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: The Senator...

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: I'm sorry, Bill.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: Don't be. I'm not cut out to deal with the West's of the world.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: You're a good soldier, Bill.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: I thought you said that wasn't a compliment.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: It was so good, I actually forgot you're one of the bigger dogs now. The Base Commander. The one in control. You couldn't let him testify, could you?

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: If you let him testify then it would have all come out. West was supposed to take care of it out there, shut Nunez up and then disappear. But it got messy and people got killed. So you called your old pal Tom Hardy, figuring if worse came to worse, he'd cover for you.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: You're drunk --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: I'm not going to cover for you, Bill. Not for this.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Stay where you are.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: Or what? You've gone round the bend --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: West had a partner. Someone who knew how to get things done.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: What I can't understand is why you signed these. If you'd just let West take care of the paperwork, no one would have known, but you got careless. So when Pike finally told the truth you had to get rid of him, too.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: That's preposterous --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Toxicology report came back. Kendall's attack was caused by a drug known as anephadrine, maybe you've heard of it. It's for asthmatics. If an epileptic takes enough, it kills them. I checked with the nurses at the hospital -- you're the only other person who visited Kendall.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: I wanted to see if he was okay --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: You poisoned him, Bill. You heard our interrogation, you knew he was ready to crack, so you killed him, just like Pike.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: I'm not even going to dignify that --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: No! You will stand there and you will listen! What happened to you, Bill? You were the one who joined up to do good in the world. You were the one who believed in it --

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: You want to get into a finger pointing contest about character? The army kicked you out for drugs, the cops fired you for taking bribes from a mobster, and you think you can stand there and lecture me on codes of conduct? There's only one criminal standing in this room and it's you.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Not for long.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: No more witnesses. West's a ghost. But it doesn't matter because we have your signature, the hospital log, and Kendall's toxicology report. And that'll be enough.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: You're crazy --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: You can't duck this, Bill. I may have done every goddamn thing in my life wrong but I won't let this happen.

turns.speaker: STYLES
turns.text: For the last time, I have no idea what you're talking about --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Get your hands away from the desk!

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Hostile and uncooperative.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Fantastic. You want to tell me what's going on?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Ah, Christ

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: You knew Sergeant West?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: He was our Drill here. Man's older than sand.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: I didn't mean that as a compliment.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Sergeant West's served for twenty- three years. He's the public face of the modern Army.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: And you notice I'm not in the Army anymore.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Gotta be honest, I love what you've done with the place --

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: You and the Colonel go back.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: He got me through Basic and a lot of other stuff. I owe him.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: You're the Tom Hardy I've been reading about in the papers, right? New Orleans PD fired you for taking bribes from Guissepe Torres.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: It was for suspicion of bribery, it's really all in the wording --

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Wording and your friendship with the Colonel aside, I'm not comfortable having you involved in this.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Subtlety really isn't one of you finer points, is it, Osborne?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Three things. First -- You don't have a choice. Second -- I've never taken a bribe in my life. And Third -- I'm still a little drunk from last night, so if I skip over the witty banter and move forward to straight hitting on you, try not to take offense. Tell me about the two guys.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Hurricane knocked out our Mainframe, so all we have are their dogtags. Cadets Raymond Dunbar and Levi Kendall --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Levi? Who names their kid Levi --

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Senator Jonathan Kendall, of Ohio.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Christ... Remind me to thank Bill for mentioning that on the phone --

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Kendall Junior is still in surgery, so he won't be available to answer for his name or anything else for another hour -- the cadet we're talking to first is Dunbar.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: He's in interrogation?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Move him.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Because interrogation rooms look suspiciously like interrogation rooms, which doesn't exactly put people at ease. Is he cute?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Is Dunbar cute?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: That is the most unprofessional --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Is he handsome, self assured, carry himself well, does he look you in the eyes or down at the floor, does he have good bones, suggesting good breeding, does he slouch or sit up straight -- these are important questions, as they reveal a great deal about this man's character so please get over yourself for two and a half seconds and tell me is he cute?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Thank you. At some point in there I'm gonna rub my nose. When I do, go at him with everything you got.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Good cop/bad cop?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Something like that.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: I questioned him for three hours and he didn't make a sound. You don't have a badge, he won't talk to you.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Ten bucks says I have him talking in under three minutes.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: The Colonel saw you shoot Nunez, you're a murderer --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: See, Ray, this is what we call "good cop, bad cop". She shouts, I stand up for you, you're grateful, a bond of trust is established.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Baseball?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: I believe somebody owes me ten dollars --

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: You made me look like an idiot --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Oh, I'm sorry, I didn't know the object of the interrogation is to make you look good -- Everyone knows good cop, bad cop -- by admitting it I appeared trustworthy.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: You really want to make banal chit- chat like that now?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: You're right. We should sit in silence.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: We're in the middle of a murder case --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Best time for banal chit-chat.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: What is that?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Microrecorder for Kendall -- didn't have time to wire his room. Now tell me why you joined the army or I'll jab this pen through your neck.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Typical army brat story. Dad was noncom, Mom was a Nurse. There was never any real doubt of joining up.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: You had a mobile of bayonets above your crib.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Something like that. You?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: I lost a bet.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: You're kidding.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Yeah. That's just the story I tell the girls to get them into bed. Truth is... I don't know. The whole honor and duty thing. Make a difference in the world, crap like that. Didn't really work out.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: This is the straight hitting on me you were talking about, isn't it?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: The very same.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: You do understand that there's absolutely no way I could ever be attracted to you, right?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: I plan to grow on you.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: You're off to a late start.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: So noted.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: You guys really got the shit kicked out of you here.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Imagine what it must have been like for them out there. What do you think of Dunbar?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: He's telling the truth, up to a point.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: What point?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Something wrong?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Being back here. Gives me the willies.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Not the happiest of memories?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Remember, he's the son of a Senator, so go easy. Kid gloves.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: That was kid gloves?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Have no fear, Osborne, we have not yet begun to fight.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: But we have to question him --  Thought you didn't have cigarettes --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: I lied. Wait for it...

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: "Too neat." How long have you been an investigator?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: I don't think that has anything to do with --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: That means under a year. Let me explain what ten years of police work has taught me -- murder is basic. There are no conspiracies, no grand mysteries, and no evil puppet masters behind it all, pulling the strings; murder is shitty people doing a shitty thing to other shitty people -- it doesn't always make sense but it's always neat. Dunbar's our guy.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: I just... He came back for Kendall. I don't think he's capable of murder.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Everyone's capable of murder, Osborne.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Look, all we've got is what Kendall says, and he didn't actually witness any deaths except Nunez. He found West, he saw Mueller and Pike, but just their bodies -- he didn't see any crime committed.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Well, I'm sure if he'd known this was all going to happen he'd have tried harder to witness it for you --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Why the fuck wasn't he in restraints?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Styles couldn't reassign him, he's a legend --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: You knew what he was capable of and you just stood by. It was just a matter of time till somebody fragged his ass, and you know what? He deserved it. There's your confession.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Goddammit, Hardy, you can't just leave --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Watch me.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: You said you owed Styles and now you're gonna turn your back on him?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: West was a monster! Fifteen years ago, I was here, I was Section Eight, I was Pike. Fuck being the knife dummy -- that thing he did, stripping Pike down, making him stand outside all night? He did that every year, he did that to me. Fifteen years ago, I wanted him dead, and now I'm supposed to care that somebody offed him? Sorry, no can do. I tried.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: You did more than try. You cracked Dunbar in less than three minutes, as an investigator you're phenomenal --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Phenomenal at taking bribes, right?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: I was starting to believe you, you know? That you weren't who everyone said. I guess I was wrong --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Oh, spare me the reverse psychology bullshit! This isn't my "great second chance", Osborne. Everyone thinks I'm a piece of shit cop who took money and nothing is going to change that. Nobody will ever know what happens here --

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: But you will.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Why do you care?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Because it's my job. Because people are dead. Because of the whole honor and duty thing, make a difference in the world, crap like that.  We can do this, Hardy.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: I didn't shoot West...

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Dunbar... He said he didn't shoot West. West wasn't shot, Kendall said he was blown apart by a phosphorous grenade and Dunbar never saw the body.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: At least you and Kendall agree on that.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: What happened next?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Talk it through: Childs, Mueller, and Nunez know they're going out on the regular Tuesday Night drill, hurricane or no hurricane, so they plan it: Kill West, pin it on Pike.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: And they're smart about it. They know when you commit a crime you know is going to be investigated, you need a fall guy and for that to work, you have to have a witness.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Dunbar.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Exactly, someone who's not involved, who's word can't be questioned. You only let them see what you want them to see, you make them believe, so when the time comes, they've totally bought into your version of events.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: They believe the innocent are guilty and the guilty are innocent.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: And if they're asked, that's what they'll tell the, world.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: So it's a good plan but it goes wrong; Mueller flips out and shoots their fall guy, which means they have to bring Dunbar and Kendall into the cover story --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Kendall maybe would have agreed, but the hurricane buttfucks the cabin --

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Buttfucks the cabin?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: And all hell breaks loose. A lot of Good guys shoot a lot of bad guys and whiz, bang, zoom, happy ending.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: So why, after Dunbar drags Kendall out from under a house, does the Senator's son try and get us to put his savior in the gas chamber?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: That bugs you too?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Little bit.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Let's go talk to Bill...

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: We're fucked, I know --

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: They got their stories straight.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: What Kendall said -- "the type of guys you don't feel comfortable going to sleep around." That's what Dunbar said about Childs to the letter.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Positive. Hardy, they planned this.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Why don't you talk to Levi off the record for a second?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Good idea.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: That's a fantastic idea --

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: See, I just take your gun to the morgue and fire it into one of their skulls; then I call every newspaper in the country with the story about how Senator Kendall's gay son went nuts on a training mission --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: I pushed him too hard.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: You couldn't have known --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Yeah, I could've. Should've.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: You wanted to get the truth.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: No, I didn't. I wanted to humiliate him. For what he did to Dunbar. For fucking over the little guy.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: You mean the falsely accused?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: You wanted to break him.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: So did I.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: So what now?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Now I go home, get drunk, and try and forget this ever happened.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Think it'll work?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Nah.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: You know, you never told me why you left the army.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: It dawned on me one day that we were supposed to be a nation founded on the principle of questioning authority... and all I did here was follow orders. It didn't add up. Plus, I got kicked out.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: That's gonna stay my secret.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: We were close to something with Kendall.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Maybe... Maybe we were nowhere near. Sometimes mysteries stay mysteries.  I haven't by any chance grown on you, have I?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Good, just making sure.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Four --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Get in.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: We got maybe three minutes till they break it down.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Right back where we started.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Hardy, what are you doing --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Isn't this how your story goes?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: We can tie you to the chair if it'll work better for you --

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Hardy, for Chrissakes --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: WHERE'S WEST'S BODY?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: No bodies, no West...

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: No death certificates. No crime.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: We need to talk --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Seven.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Seven guys. What was it you said? You were "just starting to believe I wasn't the guy people said".

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: This isn't the time --

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: This is the perfect time. You know what makes a good detective? The number of confessions they get. You're a good detective, Osborne. So now you get mine.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: What if I don't want it?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Tough.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: That's not true.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: There are degrees of truth, officer. Always degrees.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: You're a good man, Hardy.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Really.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Far as I'm concerned, whatever you did in the past can stay in the past.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: West?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Nobody saw. But I don't think so.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Do I have a choice in this?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Yeah. I can wait till you're off the base and do it myself.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: What are you doing out here?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Leaving without saying goodbye. What are you gonna do?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Go home, get drunk, and try and forget this ever happened.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Think it'll work?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Nah.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Want company?

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: A word of advice about women -- that first hour or so after they kill their boss? Probably not the best time to hit on them.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: I should probably write that down.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Your phone number?

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: In case you need me to testify about the shooting. They'll clear you.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: He was your friend.

turns.speaker: HARDY
turns.text: Yeah. But he was a lot of other things, too. Thanks.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: The thing is, we've got a real opportunity here. You turn me in tomorrow and we're both fucked --

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: A gay Senator's son who let his Sarge get fragged on a training exercise? The press'll crucify you and your father. His career will be over and it'll be your fault. But we do this different and you come out a hero.

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Mueller. He's as bad as West and we both know it. Now I can't do it, cause I'm tied up, but we get the others to go along --

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: I don't think I want to hear this --

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Someone else can do the deed, it doesn't have to be you. Maybe Nunez too, he's got a tendency to follow Mueller, but the rest of us can come out ahead -- the guys who took out their Sergeant's killers! We'll move the bodies out to the creek and say we came over the hill right as they fragged West, all we gotta do is tell the story right.

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: Pike, please --

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Although that won't matter much when coupled with the murder charge --

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: Maybe we shouldn't go.

turns.speaker: MUELLER
turns.text: The faggot speaks.

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: You ever been in a hurricane, Mueller?

turns.speaker: MUELLER
turns.text: You ever been in a hurricane, Mueller?

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: We should tell him we're not going.

turns.speaker: MUELLER
turns.text: Oh, yeah, "Excuse me, Sergeant, sir, we don't feel like going out -- we don't want to get rained on." He'll kick our asses from here to Cleveland.

turns.speaker: MUELLER
turns.text: They found him. Poor fucker was practically blown in half --

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: Poor fucker my ass...

turns.speaker: MUELLER
turns.text: You better watch it, faggot, I'm not sure you and Childs didn't do him --

turns.speaker: MUELLER
turns.text: Pike and I got separated --

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: Yeah and he doesn't know when --

turns.speaker: MUELLER
turns.text: I remember now, it was before the explosion --

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: Oh, you remember now --

turns.speaker: MUELLER
turns.text: I'm about two seconds away from seeing if fairies really can fly --

turns.speaker: MUELLER
turns.text: I was freezing from the hurricane --

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: So you took off your shirt?

turns.speaker: MUELLER
turns.text: To start a fire, goddammit!  What about him, huh? Maybe he offed the Sarge and changed shirts, brought an extra one in his pack. Y'ever think of that? Go ahead, cut him loose! First chance he gets, he'll waste the rest of us, that's how they work --

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: We just want --

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: What, "The Truth"? Please. There are degrees of truth, officer, always degrees. Things are not what they seem.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: He couldn't kick you out so he wanted you to quit on your own.

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: He wanted more than that.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: He said what?

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: "You're gonna die tonight, faggot". Clear as day.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: No one else heard it?

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: He whispered it in my ear.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: Nunez was chasing Dunbar.

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: Because he'd shot Mueller.

turns.speaker: OSBORNE
turns.text: But you didn't see it, right?

turns.speaker: KENDALL
turns.text: Like I said, I was in the kitchen. When I came out, Mueller and Pike were dead, Nunez and Childs were hit and Dunbar was gone.
